required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of OPC-12759 Ophthalmic Solution
clinical_study.official_title: Safety Study of OPC-12759 Ophthalmic Solution in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety of OPC-12759 ophthalmic solution in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Blurred Vision After Instillation
primary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with white blurred vision after first and/or second instillation was calculated for subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Bitter Taste
primary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with bitter taste on first and/or second instillation was calculated for subjects.

arm_group.description: A single dose of OPC-12759 Ophthalmic solution for two-day treatment
A single dose of OPC-12759 Ophthalmic suspension for two-day treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI : {body weight (kg) / [height (m)] 2 } must be 17.6 or greater, and less than 26.4 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of ocular disorder
2. Intraocular pressure of 21mmHg or higher
3. Corrected visual acuity of less than 1.0
4. Dysfunction of nasolacrimal duct or history of surgery related to nasolacrimal duct or eye lid which affects the nasolacrimal outflow
5. History of refractive surgery
6. History of other ocular surgeries within 12 months
7. Those who cannot discontinue the use of contact lenses from the 1st dose to 5-hour-post-dose

overall_official.affiliation: Director of Division of Dermatologicals and Ophthalmologicals, Otsuka Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was a single-center, randomized, crossover, open-label study.

group.title: OPC-12759 Solution With Nasal Root Pressed, Then OPC-12759 Solution Without Nasal Root Pressed
group.description: One drop of 2% OPC-12759 ophthalmic solution was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

group.title: OPC-12759 Solution Without Nasal Root Pressed, Then OPC-12759 With Nasal Root Pressed
group.description: One drop of 2% OPC-12759 ophthalmic solution was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

group.title: OPC-12759 Suspension With Nasal Root Pressed, Then OPC-12759 Solution Without Nasal Root Pressed
group.description: One drop of OPC-12759 ophthalmic suspension was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

group.title: OPC-12759 Suspension Without Nasal Root Pressed, Then OPC-12759 Solution With Nasal Root Pressed
group.description: One drop of OPC-12759 ophthalmic suspension was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

group.title: OPC-12759 Solution
group.description: One drop of 2% OPC-12759 ophthalmic solution was instilled into each eye once.

group.title: OPC-12759 Suspension
group.description: One drop of OPC-12759 ophthalmic suspension was instilled into each eye once.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Blurred Vision After Instillation
outcome.description: The number of subjects with white blurred vision after first and/or second instillation was calculated for subjects.
outcome.population: Analysis set consisted of all subjects who had received the investigational product at least once.

group.title: OPC-12759 Solution With Nasal Root Pressed/Not Pressed
group.description: One drop of 2% OPC-12759 ophthalmic solution was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

group.title: OPC-12759 Suspension With Nasal Root Pressed/Not Pressed
group.description: One drop of OPC-12759 ophthalmic suspension was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Blurred Vision After Instillation
measure.description: The number of subjects with white blurred vision after first and/or second instillation was calculated for subjects.
measure.population: Analysis set consisted of all subjects who had received the investigational product at least once.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Bitter Taste
outcome.description: The number of subjects with bitter taste on first and/or second instillation was calculated for subjects.
outcome.population: Analysis set consisted of all subjects who had received the investigational product at least once.

group.title: OPC-12759 Solution With Nasal Root Pressed/Not Pressed
group.description: One drop of 2% OPC-12759 ophthalmic solution was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

group.description: One drop of OPC-12759 ophthalmic suspension was instilled into each eye once. Subjects who were instructed to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked not to press it at the second instillation, and subjects who were instructed not to press the nasal root at the first instillation (n=25) were asked to press it at the second instillation. The second instillation was conducted within 14 days after the first instillation.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Bitter Taste
measure.description: The number of subjects with bitter taste on first and/or second instillation was calculated for subjects.
measure.population: Analysis set consisted of all subjects who had received the investigational product at least once.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment period (2 days up to 15 days)
reported_events.desc: Safety analysis set consisted of all subjects who had received the investigational product at least once. White blurred vision after instillation and bitter taste were not considered to be adverse events because they were the specific symptoms for study evaluation. Adverse Events detected were systemic and not attributable to one specific intervention or another.

group.title: OPC-12759 Solution
group.description: One drop of 2% OPC-12759 ophthalmic solution was instilled into each eye (instillation was conducted twice, the second instillation was within 14 days after the first instillation).

group.title: OPC-12759 Suspension
group.description: One drop of OPC-12759 ophthalmic suspension was instilled into each eye (instillation was conducted twice, the second instillation was within 14 days after the first instillation).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
